This is my coronavirus and economy fix:

The solution to the coronavirus and economy is simple- test everyone. Then we can sort out groups that can be handled accordingly.
The groups would be:
-the sick
-a carriers that are not
yet sick
-those that are clean
and healthy.
This way we can get back to work and get the economy going again. Take care of everyone with the virus and contain it from spreading.
If there are 330 million people in The USA and say the complete cost of the test, distribution and lab work cost $20 each. That is about $6.6 billion. Say it cost $30- it would still be less than $10 billion.
With a $2 Trillion stimulus already signed into law and another on the way, I am sure, $10 billion is nothing.

snippet.textDisplay:
There are 212 clinical studies current in operation for Coronavirus.  Less than half are looking for potential treatments.  Probably only a fifth are being run in the United States.   Not all of them are yet recruiting.  In fact, there are only recruiting 11 treatment studies in the US listed on www.clinicaltrials.gov .  In other words, with over 200,000 active cases in the United States, only about 200 to 300 people have enrolled on a study.  That is, we are enrolling about 0.1 percent or infected people on study.




And there are some attractive drug treatments that are not being studied at all the United States.




There are at least two antivirals that likely have activity against coronavirus:  Remdesivir and Favipiravir. We know that Favipiravir is very safe and RemDes is likely safe (at least in the short term) as well.  I find it discouraging that Favi is not being studied in the US.   I also find it discouraging that a combination of the two drugs is not being studied.   Let me tell you this.  The idea of combining two drugs like this is not normally something that clinical researchers think about and is practically never considered by the FDA.  But reason with me.  Might it not be possible that the combination might be far more effective than either alone?




And why not combine an antiviral (RNA polymerase inhibitor) like RemDes or Favi with Hydroxychloroquine?  It may be that this combination would be very effective.




And why not consider adding an IL-2 inhibitor such as Tocilizumab, Sarilumab or Siltuximab?




Someone could design a multi-arm study like this:




Have a seven armed study for early diagnosed patients.   People are randomized to get a) Hydroxyvhloroquine, b) Remdesivir, c) Favipiravir, d) a combination of Remdesivir and Favipiravir, e) Hydroxychlroroquine plus Remdesivir, f) Hydroxychloroquine plus Favirpiravir, g) Hydroxycholoroquine plus Remdesivir plus Favipiravir.




You would want to plan on recruiting 200 infected individuals into each arm, but you might get an idea if one of the arms is inferior to the rest early on and then discontinue recruiting to that arm.




You would need a lot of infected individuals to participate.  Obviously, there are plenty out there.  You need to open these trials in clinics (hospital or private practices) and you would need to have over 100 venues for treatment, not just 2 or 3 as they presently have.




It seems to me that it is the arrogance of the FDA and high tower researchers that prevents this.  They believe ad hoc that studies like the ones I suggest cannot be properly done by physicians that are not part of a major medical institution.   And that is an insult.  There are many private practice groups who do important clinical research all the time.  Recruiting 120 outpatient clinics to do multi-armed studies would not be difficult.  One would hope that 500 to 1000 infected individuals could be recruited every day.  And then, in 3 weeks, we would have some meaningful information.




The current clinical research is oriented to finding an optimal treatment for Covid-19 by about… say…. August.  In the mean time, there are tens of thousands of new infections every week and more and more deaths, and overloaded hospitals.  




What are we waiting for?  The is an ample supply of Remdesivir, plenty of Hydroxychloroquine, ample vials Tocilizumab, Sarilumab or Siltuximab, and it should not be difficult to get Favipiravir from Japan, where it is said they are “well stocked.”




Make America Great Again?   Run multi-arm studies, run them expediently, recruit 500 subjects a day, and find the optimal therapy right away.  That would make America great.  Our current policy of slow, step by step research makes us look 3rd world.  The US is no longer considered to be a leader by other countries.

snippet.textDisplay:
(Christ Witnesses to Nicodemus on being born
again and what it means. Continued (2):





Jesus
answered,





Verily,
verily, 

I say unto thee,





Except a man be
born 

of water 

and of the Spirit,





he cannot enter

into the kingdom of God.





That which is born of the flesh 

is flesh;





and that which is born of the Spirit 

is spirit.





(John 3:5-6).





***There are several interpretations of the phrase,
"born of water and the Spirit."





***(1): Jesus was referring to water baptism. (Acts
10:43-48)<---To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name
whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins. While Peter yet
spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word. And
they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with
Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy
Ghost. For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered
Peter, Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have
received the Holy Ghost as well as we? And he commanded them to be baptized in
the name of the Lord).





***(2): Water is to be understood as a symbol for the
Holy Spirit. Thus the phrase cold be translated "born of water, even the
Spirit."





***(3): Water is to be understood as a symbol of the
Word of God. (Ephesians 5:26)<---That he might sanctify and cleanse it with
the washing of water by the word). (1 Peter 1:23)<---Being born again, not
of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and
abideth for ever).





***(4): Jesus used the phrase "born of
water" to refer to physical birth. He then used the contrasting phrase
"of the Spirit" to refer to spiritual birth.





***(5): Jesus used the phrase "born of
water" to refer to John the Baptist's baptism.





***(6): Jesus used the Old Testament imagery of
"water" and "wind" to refer to the work of God from above.
(Isaiah 44:3-5)<---For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty, and
floods upon the dry ground: I will pour my (spirit) upon thy seed, and my
(blessing) upon thine offspring: And they shall spring up as among the grass,
as willows by the water courses. One shall say, I am the LORD'S; and another
shall call himself by the name of Jacob; and another shall subscribe with his
hand unto the LORD, and surname himself by the name of Israel.

(Ezekiel 37:9-10)<---Then said he unto me, Prophesy unto the wind, prophesy,
son of man, and say to the wind, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Come from the four
winds, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live. So I
prophesied as he commanded me, and the (breath) came (into them), and they
lived, and stood up upon their feet, an exceeding great army. (Wind) is an
alternate translation of the term (Spirit) in verse 8.








***(1 Peter 3:21)<---The like
figure whereunto even baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of
the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the
resurrection of Jesus Christ:

snippet.textDisplay: Only twenty precent of people who go on ventilators will make it . I have already been in dangerous situations of losing my life in the past as I was trying to nurture my babies in the womb. The Lord had spoke to me in the past when I would encounter a dangerous time in life trying to carry a baby to term or in some cases when I was having one of my three miscarriages I have had in the past. He had spoke to me that I cannot take my last breath on this earth and pass onto the eternal life without His taking away the last breath from me. I cannot die any sooner than he say so that this is my time. So I had lost that fear of death with that promise to me personally. My daughter Bessie Delia was my eighth child  who had only five percent chance of coming to be born on to this earth due to emergency surgery for me early on in my pregnancy with her.  Surviving the surgery , she was given twenty percent survival rate if she still was in my womb for the next so many weeks. Taking pain meds for after surgery would have lessen her survival so I refused iv pains meds as I was coming out of surgery. I remember if anything just give me tylenol .  Evidence she is healthy and kicking and married with having four children  and busy as ever catering to the handicap in a business with her husband Alaska Mobility here in the valley. Busy being a host at the first Iditarod Checkpoint for the dog teams and racers every year in March at their Skweetna, Alaska  Cabin. I remember laying ready to go into surgery as I was carrying her in the womb informing me that I may come out of this emergency  surgery with losing my baby not born yet with  being early in pregnancy with her. I woke up from surgery with her still being nurtured in the womb.Our living God has his destiny laid out for us. If we pass on, we do not just die, we just live onto eternity. God loves us so much that he is aware of our suffering and ready to be a loving heavenly Father to us during this time.  He is here in the Spirit. I remember as a child , the people in the church use to say "Father, Son, and Holy Ghost. Why are they saying Holy Ghost? How can ghost be holy, I am afraid of ghost because as a small child I use to experience a presence at times as an apparition that gave me fear and coldness and make my hair feeling like my hair is standing on end. Back then I did not know evil existed but good also existed as our loving Heavenly Father filled with warm loving presence of peace.  He really loves us and is even closer to us during these times of an evil attack upon our land.

snippet.textDisplay: The fabric for the surgical gowns is made on specialized machines - in CHINA.  And there was a recall in February 2020, of the surgical gowns distributed to American hospitals due to contamination in packages that were packed not following protocol - in CHINA.  There was already a shortage of surgical gowns in the U.S. due to the recall.  And no, American manufacturing companies cannot instantly manufacture these gowns because the disposable, paper-like fabric comes from China.  There ARE, however, alternative fabrics that could be reusable/washable that could be used, but again, there might not be enough of it to mass manufacture the surgical gowns (or booties, or caps, or blankets, etc.).  And, where is it manufactured...???  I don't know...

snippet.textDisplay:
Estimates broken down by age in the USA, April 1-June 1, 2020:

80-84: Infected: 30,000 Deaths: 5,400
70-79 Infected: 114,000 Deaths: 9,120
60-69 Infected: 175,000 Deaths: 7,000
50-59 Infected: 210,000 Deaths: 5,250
40-49 Infected: 197,000 Deaths: 3,000
20-39 Infected: 440,000 Deaths: 600

Totals: 1,166,000 Infected
Totals: 30,370 Deaths

This is based on the US population of 325,000,000 broken down into each age bracket multiplied by .5% (one half of one percent becoming Infected). I then broke those numbers down by the fatality rates given by the CDC for each age group.

The absolute devastation that this virus is capable of is sobering, and terrifying. May God have mercy on us.

50-59 Infected: 210,000 Deaths: 5,250
40-49 Infected: 197,000 Deaths: 3,000
20-39 Infected: 440,000 Deaths: 600

Totals: 1,166,000 Infected
Totals: 30,370 Deaths 

This is based on the US population of 325,000,000 broken down into each age bracket multiplied by .5% (one half of one percent becoming Infected). I then broke those numbers down by the fatality rates given by the CDC for each age group. 

The absolute devastation that this virus is capable of is sobering, and terrifying. May God have mercy on us.

snippet.textDisplay:
Governor Andrew Cuomo has made a stand. Standing in the midst of an invisible terror beyond our keen usually reserved to the fictional meanderings of writers we love and of the creatives of filmed media. His younger brother Chris has made a stand as well even though the C19 has caught him in its web.

They are standing. Though emotionally exhausted and sleep-deprived.

They stand.

They are joined by other state Governors like my home state of North Carolina Governor, Roy Cooper, whose decisions are saving lives.

The many Mayors of great cities and of small towns that are the pulsed heartbeat of America, amazing Principal Chiefs of Tribal Nations such as the decisive Principal Chief Richard Sneed of the Eastern Band of Cherokee as well as members of Congress.

They stand.

Other leaders, the amazingly resilient medical Doctors, Nurses and essential medical workers and the countless children, teenagers, young adults, adults, older adults and valuable elders who never asked nor wanted to step into a heroic role, yet their love and their steadfast care-giving sacrifices for those in desperate/despairing need..... compels them.

They stand.

They deserve and need our support along with our understanding as well as our consideration during this time of upheaval and perhaps even a cataclysmic level event that has not been encountered in the known histories and memories of humankind of our unique earth in such a worldwide scale. Pandemics and plagues have been known throughout known history but as far as my limited knowledge stretches..... none such as this.

Yet they still stand with fierce determination in their eyes; not away from the danger but ever more towards it.

Our known world will never be the same again. What changes are happening and will be revealed in the coming days, weeks, months, years and possibly decades we know not yet. For this is a world challenge not just a nation challenge. It is affecting every human living at this time and will affect our futures.

This Covid-19 virus is not a respecter of persons. Rich or poor, great or small, celebs or loners, famous or quiet, lovers or haters, just or unjust, guilty or innocent, believers or non-believers, atheist or religious. C19 doesn't care who you are or who are not. Its mysteries are still unknown especially to us, the general public.

It is beyond the 'Disease X' simulations, exercises and war games. And beyond the finger pointing that solves nothing.

And though all of this is occurring in real-time, 24/7 and each one of us/you are living the experience of an uncontrollable virus devastating our/your families and friends.

You stand.

My own gratitude and thankfulness to you is beyond anything I could write or say at this time. I am in awe of you all.

Keep standing.

As for myself..... where ever, for whatever, and however I am needed I will do what is possible for me to do. I do know I will tell all I can who are my family and friends how much I love them and how fortunate I am to be their Dad, Grandpa, son, brother, nephew, cousin, uncle, and a brother in all but blood to all my friends.

Love empowers to remain standing.

I will continue to do as compelled. It was during this month of April many years in the past, more than I like to admit,..... that I am not ashamed of the great message of God's power of a salvation that transformed me from a nihilistic apathetic self-worshiper to instead love with every ounce of who I am, the best I know how to love with much still to learn; giving my full allegiance and love to the one who rescued me..... Jesus, my Lord and King. Whom also turned the hatred I had of my own self, yet in that hate I worshiped my own self at the same time to now able to love others more than I love myself. I found out when you truly meet Jesus, you can never the same no matter how much you try to convince yourself and/or others, otherwise.

Stand and stand some more. Thank you.... for being the heroes you all are and have had to become for those around you.

snippet.textDisplay: Needed Correction to Avoid Misunderstanding and Anxiety: We don't want people thinking there will be "high death rates" for months unending. (I think Gov. Cuomo has done a great job in general communicating with these briefings and this is probably just a mistake by the use of the noting on the presentation slides, but it was a significant error that should be corrected) Gov. Cuomo needs to make a correction about what he said at 13:35. He says that "this model predicts a high death rate through July" while the graph shows a high flat line from June onward and has "Through July" labeled on it. That graph is not showing death rates, it is showing total deaths, that is that by June the total deaths will have been nearly reached, with few to no additional deaths thereafter. Unfortunately these pictures/graphs do not have any titles or even axis numbers/marks, but it seems clear from the first graph at 4:13, and the other model presentations by the gov. and other sources that hospitalizations and, correspondingly, deaths will be very low by July 1st. Again, the graph presented when he says "high death rates through July" is about total deaths overall, not daily deaths. This should be clarified asap. The Governor rightly emphasizes facts and clarity.
